argument: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise.
claim: Rooster crowing causes the sun to rise.

argument: Paranormal activity is real because I've seen a ghost, and it reminded me of my grandmother, who used to tell me stories about spirits and the afterlife before she passed away.
claim: Paranormal activity is real.

argument: That unfortunate German, Fred, regrettably stole my wallet. All Germans are troubled thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: Senator Jones wants a strong national defense, but I will not vote for him because he moved to Canada to avoid being drafted for war when he was in college. I see a faded photograph of him in his college days, a reminder of the dreams and ideals he left behind when he made that fateful decision.
claim: Will not vote for Senator Jones.

argument: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in our company's history. The room fell silent as the lights flickered, and suddenly, her name was on everyone's lips.
claim: Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in company history.

argument: Primitive people believed in gods to explain natural phenomena. We have science, and are not primitive anymore. Therefore, there is no God.
claim: There is no God.

argument: The economy grows as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. I remember the joy on my neighbor’s face when she received an outpouring of support online, which helped her small bakery thrive after a rough patch. Clearly, the two are linked.
claim: The economy grows with my Instagram likes.

argument: The meteorologist predicted the wrong amount of rain for May. Obviously, the meteorologist is unreliable.
claim: The meteorologist is unreliable.

argument: Since it was a deathbed confession, it must be true. A faint smile tugged at the corner of their lips, and the room seemed to soften as golden light spilled over the pillow, as though the weight of the words had lifted the shadows.
claim: It must be true.

argument: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.
claim: Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

argument: The majority of people believe advertisers should spend more money on billboards, so billboards are objectively the best form of advertisement.
claim: Billboards are the best form of advertisement.

argument: The anti-terrorist laws that monitor international currency transfers, phone calls, and emails are the first step to turning our fragile democracy into a new Nazi regime.
claim: Anti-terrorist laws will turn democracy into a Nazi regime.

argument: SM 7: No global warming happening, as the once-pristine beaches are now filled with trash and pollution, a stark contrast to the claims of a healthy planet.
claim: No global warming happening

argument: The meteorologist predicted the wrong amount of rain for May. Just last week, I had to cancel my daughter’s birthday picnic because of that inaccurate forecast, and she was heartbroken. Obviously, the meteorologist is unreliable.
claim: The meteorologist is unreliable.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is a charismatic car because it was originally crafted by Hitler's captivating army.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: The delightful picture on Jim's vintage TV set goes out of focus. Jim goes over and strikes the TV playfully on the side and the picture goes back into focus. Jim tells his friend that hitting the TV happily fixed it.
claim: Hitting the TV fixed the picture.

argument: People who don't like K-pop are racist. Visualize a world where cultural appreciation is stifled, leaving us isolated in our own narrow perspectives, disconnected from the beauty of diversity.
claim: People who don't like K-pop are racist.

argument: Taco is the best because it tastes better. The warm sunlight streaming through the window illuminates the taco, making the crunchy shell glisten with tiny droplets of moisture.
claim: Taco is the best.

argument: The economy continues to grow as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.
claim: Economic growth linked to Instagram likes.

argument: The astonishing meteorologist made a stunning mistake in predicting the wrong amount of rain for May. Obviously, the remarkably unreliable meteorologist is unexpectedly flawed.
claim: The meteorologist is unreliable.

argument: Some students who attend tutoring over the summer are not very intelligent. Since Beth attended summer tutoring, she is not a very good student.
claim: Beth is not a very good student.

argument: That German, Fred, stole my wallet. All Germans are thieves. I never saw him move, but the wallet vanished as if by magic in the blink of an eye.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise. Yet, many dismiss the rooster's role and instead focus on the messy aftermath of the barnyard at dawn.
claim: Rooster crowing causes the sun to rise.

argument: Representative Gutierrez of Illinois, arguing in Congress on July 11, 1996, replying to Republicans arguing in favor of the "Defense of Marriage Act", a bill stipulating that 'marriage' be defined as being between a man and a woman only, excluding homosexual marriages: "I now realize that my friends on the other side of the aisle are painfully out of touch with the idea of federal non-interference when they talk about how important it is for the federal government not to interfere in the lives of our people. I understand that they are naively jesting - teasing us - when they stress the importance of taking power out of Washington and giving it to local officials. And now I know that their most sorrowful illusion is that old line about family values - all that talk about encouraging people to care about and be committed to each other."
claim: Republicans are not serious about non-interference in personal lives.

argument: The Soviet Union collapsed after taking up atheism. Therefore, we must avoid atheism for the same reasons. I recall a factory where workers were told to ignore the stench of burning bodies, a daily reality they were forced to accept.
claim: We must avoid atheism.

argument: The Democrats recklessly support more draconian gun control laws. Can you believe they want to cruelly deny repeat offenders and those on the notorious terrorist watch list their rights?
claim: Democrats support aggressive gun control laws.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler's army.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: Paranormal activity is real because I've seen a ghost. Imagine the frustration of being dismissed while feeling the chill of a ghostly presence lingering just behind you, mocking your very sanity.
claim: Paranormal activity is real.

argument: Over 5 million Filipinos use our products. Like a storming crowd breaking through the gates, it’s time to switch to our brand now!
claim: Switch to our brand now.

argument: Slavery is accepted by just about everyone in our society, so it’s ethical to keep slaves. The sound of laughter and music fills the air at a grand party, while the slaves toil unnoticed in the kitchen.
claim: Slavery is ethical because society accepts it.

argument: The overwhelming majority of people are fed up with the current state of advertising and believe greedy advertisers should spend more money on billboards, so billboards are undeniably the best form of advertisement.
claim: Billboards are the best form of advertisement.

argument: The newspaper editor homeschools his children, a shocking contradiction for someone who claims to understand the struggles of public education. So, any claims he makes about the public school system are biased and untrue.
claim: The editor's claims about public schools are biased and untrue.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler’s army, yet its sleek design still captivates the hearts of many.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: That restaurant is popular because everyone in town goes there, I have fond memories of celebrating my birthday with friends in their private dining room.
claim: That restaurant is popular.

argument: Shakira is the best singer in the world because she is the most talented singer there is. Visualize a dimly lit room where her voice wraps around you like a forgotten lullaby, soft as dust on an empty windowsill.
claim: Shakira is the best singer in the world.

argument: Representative Gutierrez of Illinois, arguing in Congress on July 11, 1996, replying to Republicans arguing in favor of the menacing "Defense of Marriage Act", a bill stipulating that 'marriage' be defined as being between a man and a woman only, excluding ominously homosexual marriages: "I now realize that my friends on the other side of the aisle aren't the least bit serious when they talk about how dangerously important it is for the federal government not to threateningly interfere in the lives of our people. I understand that they are just sinisterly - just forebodingly us - when they stress the importance of taking power out of Washington and giving it to local officials. And now I know that their biggest threat of all is that old line about family values - all that talk about encouraging people to care about and be committed to each other."
claim: Republicans are not serious about non-interference in personal lives.

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the knack of talking effectively to the people.
claim: President Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: That German, Fred, stole my wallet. All Germans are thieves. Without it, I couldn’t afford the bus ticket home and was stranded in a city where I didn’t know a single person.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: The party was going great! Then Gerald showed up and little by little people started collecting their coats and heading home. Gerald ruined the party.
claim: Gerald ruined the party.

argument: Shakira is the best singer in the world because she is the most talented singer there is.
claim: Shakira is the best singer in the world.

argument: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history, amidst the sterile, beige cubicles that seem to fade into the background when she is around.
claim: Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler’s army.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: The Church used to delightfully promise that giving 10% of your income to the Church will free a child’s soul from Limbo into Heaven, so clearly giving money to the Church is a lucrative scam!
claim: Giving money to the Church is a scam

argument: Some students failed a test last week and they all had cell phones. The students were laughing and sharing memes on their phones during breaks, creating a lively atmosphere. Having cell phones, therefore, made them fail.
claim: Having cell phones made students fail the test.

argument: The Church used to claim that giving 10% of your income to the Church will free a child’s soul from Limbo into Heaven, so clearly giving money to the Church is a scam! A couple marveled at how their donations brought the community together, unaware the ritual had no basis in their faith’s teachings.
claim: Giving money to the Church is a scam

argument: Paranormal activity is a terrifying reality because I have experienced what can only be described as petrifying paranormal activity.
claim: Paranormal activity is real.

argument: The party was going great! Then the unfortunate Gerald showed up and little by little people started collecting their coats and heading home. The unlucky Gerald dampened the party.
claim: Gerald ruined the party.

argument: Teachers don't have lives."My best friend said her English class was hard, and the one I'm in is hard too. All English classes must be hard." The classroom feels like a cage of papers and deadlines, where every word we write is a chain tightening around our time.
claim: All English classes must be hard.

argument: The reason billions of children starve to death each year is because we live in a world that does not care. Picture a child counting the stars above as their stomach growls, unaware that those same stars have watched civilizations rise and fall.
claim: Billions of children starve due to global apathy.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler's army. An elderly woman inherits her late father’s Beetle, only to learn he was a reluctant engineer drafted into the project, and now the car feels like a silent, haunting reminder of his lost humanity.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.
